clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Flap Thickness Results Using the Carriazo Pendular Microkeratome - 130 Micrometers Head.
clinical_study.official_title: LASIK Flap Thickness Predictability With the Carriazo Pendular Microkeratome

brief_summary.textblock: A study of flap thickness predictability in patients submitted to Laser in Situ Keratomileusis (LASIK) with the Carriazo-Pendular microkeratome (130 micrometers head size).

primary_outcome.description: Flap thickness was calculated by subtracting the preoperative central corneal thickness minus the intraoperative residual stromal thickness. All measurements were made using ultrasound pachymetry (non-interventional technique).

study_pop.textblock: Patients submitted to LASER refractive correction at the Eye Institute of Thrace, Democritus University

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- LASIK candidates treated with the Carriazo-Pendular microkeratome - 130 micron head
Exclusion Criteria:
- corneal irregularities > 3D
- Thin corneal CCT < 460μm
- Active anterior segment disease
- Previous intraocular or corneal surgery
- History of herpetic eye disease
- Corneal scarring
- Glaucoma
- Severe dry eye
- Topographic evidence of keratoconus
